name: Mixed Bag 19 Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: What are natives of Shanghai called?
questions.explanation:
Shanghainese.

	Shanghai is the largest city on the Asian continent. Also in a broader sense they are called Chinese.

questions.text: When was the last 'Ringling Brothers' circus under the big top held?
questions.explanation:
1956.

	Labor costs and freight charges made the big top less profitable. The circus continues in indoor arenas.

questions.text: Which is not a move in breakdancing?
questions.explanation:
Diving.

	Breakdancing started in the 1980's with the rise of rap music.

questions.text: Name the Las Vegas hotel or casino where Priscilla and Elvis tied the knot.
questions.explanation:
Aladdin.

	They were married on May 1,1967 and their daughter was born exactly 9 months later on February 1, 1968.

Animal.

	It is an African antelope.

questions.text: What country celebrates Thanksgiving on the second Monday in October?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	This date was set aside in 1957 because of the earlier harvests.

questions.text: A furlong is what part of a mile?
questions.explanation:
one eighth.

	It is equal to 220 yards or 201.168 meters.

questions.text: In what year did California's Disneyland open?
questions.explanation:
1955.

	It was followed by Disney World in 1971.

questions.text: In what country was labor leader Jimmy Hoffa born?
questions.explanation:
United States.

	He was actually born in Brazil, Indiana and disappeared in 1975.

questions.text: Who narrated TV's documentary series 'The Twentieth Century'?
questions.explanation:
Walter Cronkite.

	From the late eighties untill 1992.
